entry.title: Lil Uzi Vert (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lil Uzi Vert (pictured) told the crowd at one of their concerts that they were all "going to hell"?

entry.title: OnPoint NYC (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that OnPoint NYC's safe injection sites treated 672 overdoses in their first year of operation, with no resulting deaths?

entry.title: Dave Viti (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Ralph Sazio, a Canadian Football Hall of Fame inductee, visited Boston University to scout a player, he became so impressed by Dave Viti that he signed him instead?

entry.title: Beth Yaacov Synagogue (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when it opened in 1968, the Beth Yaacov Synagogue in Madrid was the first new synagogue built in Spain since Jews were expelled from the country by the Catholic Monarchs in 1492?

entry.title: Peter Read (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Peter Read coined the term "Stolen Generations" to refer to Aboriginal children who were forcibly separated from their families by Australian governments?

entry.title: Water Droplets (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jean Sibelius likely wrote his first composition, Water Droplets, as a schoolboy?

entry.title: Tony Thompson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Benz and Phats & Small singer Tony Thompson is a former cage fighter?

entry.title: Mayoreo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kraft Heinz was "intrigued" by the fake product image of Mayoreo that became an Internet meme in June 2021?
